intro: Claoxylon metzieri, commonly known as the African sandalwood, is a small to medium-sized evergreen tree native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Meliaceae and is characterized by its smooth, greyish bark and simple, opposite leaves. The plant produces small, inconspicuous greenish-yellow flowers followed by woody, oval fruits containing flat, winged seeds. It is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forests and along riverbanks. Due to its ornamental value and potential medicinal uses, it is sometimes cultivated in horticultural settings.
